WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your soul is going wild because you're confused. If you're confused, it's usually because you don't know what's going on or what to do. This makes the soul inside your body go absolutely wild!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Think back to the last time you were confused. Remember how your soul felt? You were so confused it went wild and made you feel dumb and bad, like a wild person.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Whenever you're confused, こういち appears to offer you guidance. He's confused a lot, so he knows how to help. And knowledge offered by こういち is the best medicine for confusion.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine being confused about Japanese, for example. In your confusion everything seems scary and wild and your soul is utterly bewildered, but then here comes こういち. He sits with you and pats your back and tries to help you stop being so confused.

humanum_full_description_en:
From the " heart " to the sound of " wildness ". "Fanhu" is the same as "Trance", which means vagueness and unreality. It is also called "wildness" and "panic". Tang Dynasty Xuanying "All Classics Sound and Meaning. Volume Three: "To panic suddenly, it is a false view. But suddenly, it seems to be there or not." Such as "Chu Ci. Nine songs. "Mrs. Xiang": "Suddenly looking far away, watching the flowing water gurgling." Wang Yi's note: "Speaking of gods and ghosts suddenly, the communication is invisible, looking at it near, as if it exists, looking at it from a distance, but seeing the flow of water also gurgling. ""anthology. Liu Xiaobiao's "Demonstration of Fate": "The way is dense, loneliness and panic, invisible to see, silent to hear."

" Pain " means fear. For example, the first fold of Zheng Guangzu's "Yi Yin Gengxin" in the Yuan Dynasty: "He is always anxious for romance, and his sentences are flustered." Shi Naian's "Water Margin" Chapter 10: "Lu Yuhou screamed for mercy and panicked. I can't walk with my hands and feet."

" Pan " also means hurried, panic. For example, the second fold of Guan Hanqing's "Scheming Nizi Tiaofengyue" in the Yuan Dynasty: "Seeing that servant is timidly tidying up, I first hid it in Xiangluo's sleeve." Lao She "Camel Xiangzi": "Old Cheng ran very well. Quick, but panicked, and I can’t hold the handlebars securely.”

" Pan " can also be used as a complement in modern Chinese to indicate that the situation is unbearable. For example, the second fold of Bai Pu's "Wall Head Horse" in the Yuan dynasty: "The Sandman is entangled and panic, don't hate the ban." Qing Dynasty Cao Xueqin's "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 41: "I am lacking there, but I am panic."

humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「荒」聲。「慌忽」同「怳忽」，表示模糊不清、不真切，又作「荒忽」、「慌惚」。唐代玄應《一切經音義．卷三》：「慌忽，謂虛妄見也。惟怳惟忽，似有無有也。」如《楚辭．九歌．湘夫人》：「慌忽兮遠望，觀流水兮潺湲。」王逸注：「言神鬼荒忽，往來無形，近而視之，彷彿若存，遠而望之，但見水流潺湲也。」《文選．劉孝標〈辯命論〉》：「而其道密微，寂寥忽慌，無形可以見，無聲可以聞。」

　　「慌」表示恐懼。如元代鄭光祖《伊尹耕莘》第一摺：「他每都急急言情狀，語句意慌張。」施耐庵《水滸全傳》第10回：「陸虞候叫聲饒命，嚇的慌了手腳，走不動。」

　　「慌」也表示忙亂、慌亂。如元代關漢卿《詐妮子調風月》第二折：「見那廝手慌腳亂緊收拾，被我先藏在香羅袖兒里。」老舍《駱駝祥子》：「老程跑得很快，可是慌裏慌張，而且手老拿不穩車把似的。」

　　「慌」在近現代漢語中還可作補語，表示情況難以忍受。如元代白樸《牆頭馬上》第二折：「睡魔纏繳得慌，別恨禁持得慌。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第41回：「我那裏是乏，只是悶得慌。」

Radicals: 忄, 荒  (soul, wild)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your soul is going wild because you're confused. If you're confused, it's usually because you don't know what's going on or what to do. This makes the soul inside your body go absolutely wild!
Think back to the last time you were confused. Remember how your soul felt? You were so confused it went wild and made you feel dumb and bad, like a wild person.
Reading Mnemonic
Whenever you're confused, こういち appears to offer you guidance. He's confused a lot, so he knows how to help. And knowledge offered by こういち is the best medicine for confusion.
Imagine being confused about Japanese, for example. In your confusion everything seems scary and wild and your soul is utterly bewildered, but then here comes こういち. He sits with you and pats your back and tries to help you stop being so confused.
